bug.short_desc: Reply button does not appear on remote tasks

long_desc.thetext:
If you open a remote task (which does not exist on task list), the reply buttons does not appear.
They only appear if you collapse/expand the comment.
BTW, there is no reply for description either.

(In reply to comment #1) > BTW, there is no reply for description either.
Curious... how didn't I notice this before?

I even more curious where Rob is going to put that button...
Unless he'll just get rid of those dummy comment and description fold bars and have line Description: user, timestamp that will have [+] element for collapsing like on other comments. That would be really handy because I am already seek of scrolling that is needed to see who filled issue. :-)

(In reply to comment #3) > That would be really handy because I am > already seek of scrolling that is needed to see who filled issue. :-) >
Me too. Is there a bug for moving reporter/assignee info to a more "visible" place? By "visible" I mean: I don't have to scroll or collapse anything.

(In reply to comment #4) > (In reply to comment #3) > > That would be really handy because I am > > already seek of scrolling that is needed to see who filled issue. :-) > > > > Me too. Is there a bug for moving reporter/assignee info to a more "visible" place? By "visible" I mean: I don't have to scroll or collapse anything.
See bug#155304

(In reply to comment #5) > See bug#155304 >
Hum... I forgot that bug...
Fixed. Reply added to description. Implemented hack around bug#70358 so that reply links appear when expand all pressed.

bug.short_desc: RetargetBreakpointAction should use the "resource->launch configuration" association to find the IToggleBreakpointsTarget adapter.

long_desc.thetext:
This is just an idea for addressing a an old problem, where only one type of breakpoint can be associated with an editor. If more than one IToggleBreakpointsTarget is registered for the same editor, one of them is selected essentially at random.
Given the proposed changes to create an association between a resource and a launch configuration, it should be possible for the RetargetBreakpointAction to retrieve the IResource that is associated with a selected part (if the selected part is an editor), and then to find the associated default ILaunchConfiguration. Then the ILaunchConfiguration could be queried for a IToggleBreakpointAdapter.
There is probably a more direct way of implementing this functionality, but with the association of launch configuration to resources, it should be possible for the debugger to create the correct breakpoint type.

This seems problematic, as there is only one implementation of ILaunchConfiguration - so there can only be one adapter registered. As well, what does the breakpoint action do when there is no associated config with the editor?

Good point.
Perhaps it would be enough then to have the action ask the resource itself for an IToggleBreakpointAdapter. It would be up to the IAdapterFactory implementation to examine the resource (and to examine the default launch configuration for the resouce), and to return the toggle adapter if appropriate.
The fallback would be to just query the editor for the adapter as is done now.

Is there a reason why the returned IToggleBreakpointsTarget shouldn't handle all of the complexity itself (we've essentially done this in WTP, providing an extension point for multiple targets) or simply changing the action to call upon all of the found targets?

In my use case, I would like to be able to use the CDT Editor with non-CDT debugger. There is IToggleBreakpointTarget is implemented by the CDT-debugger which creates the standard CDT breakpoint. I certainly could request that the CDT IToggleBreakpointTarget implementation provide it's own extension point so that would delegate breakpoint creation to my debugger. But there are two down-sides to this: 1) The CDT extension point would duplicate a lot of what IToggleBreakpointTarget adapter/extension point already does. 2) This would create a dependency between my debugger and CDT debugger, which is otherwise not needed.
I didn't think there was a clean solution to this problem, because currently there is no direct connection between a resource being edited and a specific debugger. After seeing the proposed launch changes, I realized that the missing connection between a resource and a debugger may be filled in. So I would just like to be able to take advantage of that.

Created an attachment (id=56699) patch
Proposed patch that first attempts to get the breakpoint adapter from the part's associated resource before getting it from the part.

I'm going to release a slgiht modification of this patch as a workaround to the problem of mutliple debuggers using the same editor in different products. This may not be the optional solution, but provides a hook to allow editor re-use. The problem with adapters on base types is that only one can provide an adapter. However, if we use an extension point instead, we have a problem of deciding which extension wins in this case (or do we create two breakpoints).
I will release this fix and file another bug to address the larger issue.
Please verify, Mike.
verified

bug.short_desc: Eclipse hangs on breakpoint during JUnit session

long_desc.thetext: Very frequently with Eclipse 3.2/3.3 I have experienced hangs of Eclipse will breaking/stepping through code during a JUnit Plugin debug session. Typically the debugger will work for a short time and then the whole UI will become completely unresponsive. The only workaround I have found is to forcibly kill the runtime workbench being debugged. This brings back the master instance of Eclipse. However it makes debugging Junit tests almost impossible.

Next time it happens, try to create a thread dump by pressing CTRL-Break. The dump will go to the DOS console (for Sun VMs), so you need to start eclipse with java.exe instead of javaw.exe. The dump will show us where the deadlock is.
How do I go about launch eclipse with java.exe? I have always launched with eclipse.exe which seems to use javaw.
See the help doc: Workbench User Guide > Tasks > Running Eclipse. You need to use the -vm option to specify an executable - like "-vm c:\jdk1.4.2\jre\bin\java.exe"

Please see the thread dump below. It looks like it has something to do with the Browser control. My Windows->Browser setting is set to the Internal Web Browser and my default system browser is IE6 if that's any help. Mozilla and Firefox are also installed on my system.

Moving to SWT for comment.
Any progress in this area? This is gradually becoming a show-stopper because debug is no longer reliable and I can't launch Help without launching Eclipse.
This looks like a duplicate of bug 95478, which has been difficult to resolve, especially because it seems to be machine-dependent. Do you have a set of steps we can try that makes it happen for you?

On XP, with IE6, try to open the Help Contents window or perform a workbench runtime debug session and play around with the debugger until both the master and target session hangs. In the latter cases, forcibly killing the target restores the dev session.

I should have been more specific on the debugger case. Hit a breakpoint and play around with stepping through code, checking variables etc. Although I have nothing more intuition to go on, I suspect there's a link between activating a lot of tooltip-like shells while debugging in step mode. I do this a lot to check the current value of variables in the Java editor window etc.

Any progress on this issue? Now that the debugger constantly loses focus on a paused thread causing me to have to move my mouse around a lot and constantly reclick on the thread stack to see active variables and step, the debugger is basically unusable for me.
NOTE: The hang is in org.eclipse.swt.ole.win32.OleAutomation.setProperty() called from Browser<init>. We've seen this hang before. I'm looking for duplicates right now.

Bug 95478 hangs in the same method (of course you are on that bug). That bug claims that running with multiple SWT Displays (like the help system was changed to do), causes the problem. I wonder if there is some way that we could hack your Eclipse so that it doesn't do this? That way, we'd know if this is the same bug.

I'm game. Is there a way to launch a debug instance of Eclipse without it creating a new Display? I change Eclipse versions frequently (once a week to keep up with my project Ibuild), so it shouldn't be a problem trying something hacked.
(In reply to comment #13) > Bug 95478 hangs in the same method (of course you are on that bug). That bug > claims that running with multiple SWT Displays (like the help system was > changed to do), causes the problem. I wonder if there is some way that we > could hack your Eclipse so that it doesn't do this? That way, we'd know if > this is the same bug. >
Dejan, I know you no longer own the code, but can you get someone to help this guy hack out the multiple dislays on Windows code to see whether his problem goes away?
Go to the help preference page and tell it to use an external browser. It will no longer use a second Display.

bug.short_desc: Tasks marked as resolved duplicate should not be marked as completed today

long_desc.thetext: Tasks marked as resolved duplicate should not be marked as completed today (green)

Determining whether a bug is a duplicate involves an investment of the users time, even though it does not require code modification. So I think that ignoring that goes our notion of task activity and progress.

bug.short_desc: [Help] Remote help should only include relevant content

long_desc.thetext:
Currently if you store some doc plugins on a remote help server, then get a client to point to it, the client will see all documentation available even if the client doesn't have that component.
There needs to be a way to associate doc plugins with UI so that the client can only show what is relevant.

John, Dejan,
I've updated the remote help proposal with a new extension point for the mapping of help plug-ins to plug-ins they are documenting:
http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/platform-ua/proposals/help/remote_help/proposal.html
See the scope section. Please provide feedback in this bug.

Curtis, I see what you wanted to achieve but am concerned regarding the extra extension point. As a matter of fact, we have two filtering issues:
(1) Extra documentation that does not apply when RCPs are shipped without the entire platform bundle list (form example, an RCP without the team component that still contains it) (2) Extra documentation from the remote server
Why don't we solve both problems by tagging the branches with the filtering we now have up and running? We can simply go and ask each of the documentation providers to add a filtering condition for their book node that it should only be shown when a certain bundle is present. This will solve both 1) and 2) by simply using existing mechanism. Actually, for (2) we should also tag certain branches so that they are filtered as well (say, not showing Team-related nodes if team bundles are not present).
One of the reasons I would prefer that approach is that filtering would be done on the client. In some cases, users may be concerned about privacy issues since the client would be sending their entire bundle list to the server. Jim des Rivieres and myself grappled with this problem in the context of Update. There is always an issue with the client sending information about the local client's installation to the server because it can always be used for spam-related data gathering or spying.
Another unrelated comment on the API: I am somewhat concerned about the shortcut you took when it comes to TOC that is expressed in XML right now. Since our original implementation uses XML, it is convenient to us to capture data as a Node but we should not leak this into what was supposed to be general-purpose interface. What I would expect would be:
ITocContribution interface that makes no assumptions about the implementation NodeTocContribution as a helper class for implementations backed by an XML file
Similarly, why is the document talking about ITocProvider but you immediately switch to AbstractTocProvider class instead?

Fixed.
The doc plugins' tocs now have appropriate filters and will only show up when the functionality is installed locally.

bug.short_desc: RCP Log Analyzer: security is not enabled

long_desc.thetext: 1. install rac on a remote host with security enabled 2. test connection on the host 3. IWAT0112E message pops up
Seems that the security feature is missing from the LA RCP. Rough estimate 24h.

One of the required extensions in hyades.ui (i.e. JSSESecurityProviders) was not moved to common.ui during the refactoring process. I moved the extension point and extension and I've deprecated the one in hyades.ui (it's currently supported for backward compatibility).
I've added the test case, "TestingSecurity" to: org.eclipse.tptp.platform.rcp.log.tests\manual\Platform.UI.Log.RCP.Linux.testsuite org.eclipse.tptp.platform.rcp.log.tests\manual\Platform.UI.Log.RCP.Windows.testsuite
The fix has been checked into cvs - HEAD.
I forgot to re-assign the defect.
Marking as fixed with correct assignee

The TPTP-4.4.0-200703231328 driver doesnt work.
I will verify once a valid driver is available.
verified

bug.short_desc: [Quick Access] Quick Access should allow matching to an element for more than one string

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: I20061102-1715
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Use Quick Access and choose java perspective after typing "j" 2. Use Quick Access and choose java perspective after typing "jav" 3. Quick Access only remembers the java perspective was selected after typing "jav"
More information: Quick Access should support multiple strings for the same element. For example, it should remember that the Java Perspective was selected after typing "j" once, and for typing "jav" another time.
AF

Created an attachment (id=54667) multiple strings patch
This patch adds the above functionality.
AF

bug.short_desc: Not able to view html format. PDF is working

long_desc.thetext:
Trying to open reports from the application. i'm getting the following error: " The AXIS engine could not find a target service to invoke! targetService is null". This is happening only when I try to run report in html format. Here is the url that I am using: http://localhost:8100/birt-viewer/frameset?__report=Customers.rptdesign&&__format=html
I am using Jrun 4.0 as my app server. Please help me resolve this issue. I am stuck and not able to proceed with my development.
Thanks in Advance
Created an attachment (id=54668) screen shot of the error
please put apache commons-logging jar into the WEB-INF/lib folder and try it again.
Tried with commons-logging jar in WEB-INF/lib folder. Still the same error.
JRUN and BIRT all use the apache axis. They are conflicting.
Need investigation of OSGI framework to solve these conflicts.

in M5 we need resolve all the class loading issues.

bug.short_desc: setting input on a graph viewer after it has previously been set causes an SWT error

long_desc.thetext: We were simply disposing the graph too early. A fix is coming in a few minutes.
I did it again, Rob, sorry. Could you put this on the Zest component?

Created an attachment (id=54670) Patch to fix the bug.
Changed AbstractStructuredGraphViewer in the inputChanged() method to dispose the old model after the new model has been set as the contents.
Created an attachment (id=54671) mylar/context/zip

I'm re-submitting the patch with the latest version from head, as the patch is now old and stale. Please apply it.
This current patch also updates tags to be better qualified. Instead of being named bug.#, they are now zest.bug.#
Created an attachment (id=57815) resubmitting the fix created with the latest version from head.
With the refactoring of Zest, this doesn't seem to be a problem anymore. I am closing this bug. If it happens again, please re-open.

bug.short_desc: Web module still show in DD after the web project is deleted from the workspace

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce: =================== 1) Import a project that contains an EAR of J2EE 1.3 level 2) Create a dynamic web project (MyWeb) and add it to the existing EAR. --> You should see the module MyWeb.war is listed under the EAR DD 3) Remove the web project (select MyWeb -> Delete; choose to also delete the contents) from the tree. --> You can see the module MyWeb.war is still there in the list. If you open the deployment descriptor, you can see the entry:
<module id="WebModule_1164739814078"> <web> <web-uri>MyWeb.war</web-uri> <context-root>MyWeb</context-root> </web> </module> This entry should have been removed.
Note: This problem does not happen if you create a web project and add it to a new EAR. It ONLY happens when you use the imported EAR that was created in older structure (J2EE 1.3)
Charles, please investigate these defects

Our adopter product test team has hit this bug several times and requested a fix. I realize that there is a workaround, so I think it's mostly the difference in behaviour (between different EARs) that's confusing them. Is there any chance that this bug can be investigated before 1.5.3 so that we can either fix or determine an appropriate readme?

Tim, I have tried to import an 1.3 EAR which is created in the current WTP and then add/delete a web project, but could not reproduce the problem. I then tried to import an 1.3 EAR created in the product using older version of Eclipse, but the result was still the same. Can you attach an EAR here to help me to reproduce the problem? Thanks
I will send you the project.
This defect cannot be reproduced in WTP, please confirm.

Maybe the problem is fixed in newer wtp? When you say you can reproduce the problem in RAD. Do you know whether the wtp level is the same as yours? We need to test it in AST with the same wtp version. Rakan will test it once the new wtp is available.
I still see it works. Please reopen it if you see it remains a problem.
It appears that AST 6112 has picked up WTP 1.5.3 where this problem has been fixed. Thanks.
It appears that AST 6112 has picked up WTP 1.5.3 where this problem has been fixed. Thanks.
Closing Verified defects

Please reopen if this doesn't help.

bug.short_desc: Support XML Processing Instructions

long_desc.thetext: Currently, EMF does not support XML Processing Instructions as part of the model. XMLTypePackage supports mixed-content features such as CDATA, COMMENT, and TEXT, but not PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION. Adding support for PIs would allow EMF-based solutions to preserve this information in documents that use them.

Created an attachment (id=54687) Proposed patch that could address this feature request.
The attached patch introduces support for processing instructions. The actual changes are much fewer than that, but I couldn't get the generator to leave existing code formatting alone. To summarize:
1. ProcessingInstructionType is introduced:
<xs:element name="processingInstruction"> <xs:complexType> <xs:simpleContent> <xs:extension base="xs.ecore:string"> <xs:attribute name="target" type="xs.ecore:string" use="required"/> </xs:extension> </xs:simpleContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:element>
2. FeatureMapUtil is updated to support addition/detection of processing instructions.
3. XML loading and saving is updated to work with processing instructions.
4. Other minor additions, such as in item providers and GenFeatureImpl.

Created an attachment (id=54865) Proposed patch that could address this feature request.
Updated patch with removed formatting differences.

Created an attachment (id=55169) Proposed patch that could address this feature request.
This updated patch uses the "official" EMF code formatter settings. It has been generated against HEAD after many Java 5 related changes have been checked in. Note: The generator didn't generate the Stack Frame related classes in XMLTypeResourceImpl, so I approximated the changes from other types (e.g., AnyType).

[contrib email="pnehrer@freeshell.org"/]
Changes derived from your patches have been committed to CVS. A number of issues needed to be addessed, some stemming from early and unrelated changes. The instanceType of a SimpleAnyType should be considered transient in XMLSave and with the new detection of dangling IDREF references, a save problem shows up. FeatureMapEntries shouldn't be serializeable since they can't be properly deserialized; their feature needs to be considered non-transient in XMLSave. Since the special mixed contents features of the XML Type Document root are always isMany they should not be surfaced as a single valued accessor in the XMLTypeDocumentRoot's API. :-( So I've suppressed them from the API and ensured they are generated as multi-valued. The XSDEcoreBuilder was producing a bogus base class for SimpleAnyType, so that was special cased to suppress it. I renamed ProcessingInstructionType to just be ProcessingInstruction. I didn't provide the special create method for ProcessingInstruction in the factory. It's better for people to use the special FeatureMapUtil.add/createEntry methods.
That's great, I'm glad you could at least use some of it. Thank you!

attachment.desc: Proposed patch that could address this feature request.
Proposed patch that could address this feature request.
Proposed patch that could address this feature request.

bug.short_desc: Clicking a hyperlink in a stacktrace jumps file with same classname in another project

long_desc.thetext: This works as expected for me - it goes to the class in project "Second".

Note: if I paste the trace into the Java stack trace console then I go to the wrong project. However, that is because the stack trace console does not have a "launch context" to obtain a source locator from. When activating the link from the program output (process console), the launch's source locator is used, and the right class is found.

Oops, I did not tell what happens for me. I can reproduce it jumping to the "ghost" line in the "First" project, on two different Eclipse installations on two different PCs. Both are Eclipse 3.2.0.
If it is already fixed in subsequent versions, sorry for the noise.
I could not reproduce in 3.2.1 either... do the project's depend on each other at all? If you set a breakpoint in the class, where does the debugger stop?

I can reproduce the wrong linking in 3.2 and in 3.2.1, but not in I20061128-0800. I did everything from the original (Java) perspective in a fresh workspace. In the 3.2 builds, the console did not show up automatically when I ran the second Twice, so I pressed 'Alt+Shift+Q, C' to make it show up, and then clicked the link in the trace.
OK, I see this is fixed in 3.3 and does not work in 3.2.x. In 3.2.x source lookup reverts to a workspace search for hyperlinks as the filenames we parse from the links did not end in ".java".

Fixed in JavaDebugUtils and JavaStackTraceHyperlink. The fix converts the dot separated type name into a slash separated type name with a .java suffix before looking up source using a lanuch's source locator.
Please verify, Mike. Released fix to 3.2.2 stream.
verified, the fix also addresses inner class source lookup.

bug.short_desc: FontHandler.registerDirectories() causes error dialog if some of the default drives are removeable

long_desc.thetext: I put a break point into the getFontDirectory method of PDFRenderContext: it is never called. So how do you set the font directory at all?

This is fixed by adding default font paths into the configuration file org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.fonts/fontsConfig.xml: <font-paths> <path path="C:/windows/fonts"/> <path path="d:/windows/fonts"/> .... </font-paths>
If there are errors caused by paths refer to a removable drive without storage media, you can eliminate the errors by removing the path from org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.fonts/fontsConfig.xml. But make sure that at least one valid path is remained in the configuration file.

bug.short_desc: Update Manager complains about require plugins even if plugins are installed

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060629-1905
Steps To Reproduce: If in feature.xml, the dependencies is specified with requires plugin imports instead of feature, you will get error messages during update even if the plugins do exist under eclipse/plugins directory:
Current Configuration contains errors that are not corrected by the requested operation and more errors would be introduced. In details, it complains about required plugin.
below is the example feature.xml block that specifies the dependencies. <requires> <import plugin="org.apache.derby.core" version="10.2.1"/> <import plugin="org.apache.derby.ui" version="1.1.0" > </requires>

Created an attachment (id=54785) Update Site
I am unable to reproduce your problem either with Eclipse 3.2 (the build that you are using) or with the latest Eclipse 3.3 integration build.
Here is my example update site. I created a feature with 2 imported plug-ins, one which is in the site and the other (Ant) which is only in my install.
Please let me know what I have different than your setup. Thanks.

The situation is that we are using the apache derby plugin, available here: http://db.apache.org/derby/releases/release-10.2.1.6.cgi
The specific zip file to download is here: derby_core_plugin_10.2.1.452058.zip
Note: the derby plugin does not have any feature associated with it. It's packaged as just a plugin only.
Here's how I reproduce the issue. (I did this on Linux, but I'm pretty sure it's similar behavior on Windows.)
I took the attached site.zip, and changed the feature.xml inside zFeature_1.0.0.jar. I took out the org.apache.ant part and put in a requirement for derby. Here's the diff:
--- temp.orig/feature.xml 2006-11-30 13:58:26.000000000 -0800 +++ temp/feature.xml 2006-11-30 14:24:19.000000000 -0800 @@ -23,10 +23,8 @@ version="1.0.0" unpack="false"/>
- <plugin - id="org.apache.ant" - download-size="0" - install-size="0" - version="1.6.5"/> + <requires> + <import plugin="org.apache.derby.core" version="10.2.1"/> + </requires>
</feature>
I then started with a fresh Eclipse platform 3.2.1 and derby:
rm -rf eclipse workspace tar xzvf eclipse-platform-3.2.1-linux-gtk.tar.gz unzip -d eclipse derby_core_plugin_10.2.1.452058.zip eclipse/eclipse
I verify under Help->About Eclipse Platform -- Plug-in Details that org.apache.derby.core shows up with version 10.2.1.6
I pointed the update manager at the update site and select the zFeature Feature. The error pops up "ZFeature Feature (1.0.0) requires plug-in "org.apache.derby.core (10.2.1)", or compatible.
Also, the problem isn't resolved if I put the more specific version="10.2.1.6" in the feature.xml.

bug.short_desc: OptionalNamespaceExtendedMetaData Class

long_desc.thetext:
Enables models to be loaded without specifying a namespace.
See README.txt
Created an attachment (id=54678) Maven Project for Class and Documentation

Created an attachment (id=54815) Updated Cookbook Recipe for the ResourceFactory Load Options
Just added a highlight for users to remember to comment out or remove the Boolean.TRUE load option for ExtendedMetaData, when adding the OptionalExtendededMetaData...

Created an attachment (id=54816) Updated test methods
Some of the test methods were missing test at the beginning of the method...so they did not run...

Created an attachment (id=55366) Support for lax feature namespace matching.
Since it's quite common for users and even tools to get confused about XML namespace qualification, it's not uncommon to have elements that are implicitly namespace qualified when they should not be qualified and to have unqualified elements that should be qualified showing up in an instance documents.
To accomodate that we could support BasicExtendedMetaData.isFeatureNamespaceMatchingLax which when looking up a feature for a namespace/name pair will first try to find an exact match and failing that will try to find a best match. For a null-namespace/name pair, the best match will be the first feature with the same name; for a non-null-namespace/name pair, the best match will be the first feature with null-namespace and the same name. We are specifically not matching a non-null namespace to a feature with a different non-null namespace.
The unit test shows how it can be used to load several froms of invalid instance document. I.e., ones with all namespaces and ones with no namespaces.
Does this work for your scenario?

Ed,
The new BasicExtendedMetaData works great.
Very smart design.
I added some notes to your description, just to make sure I was clear on the update, so I figured I might as well paste it here.
Case1: The element is supposed to be namespaced, but is not (The case the OptionalNamespaceMetaData was for).
Case2: The element is namespaced, but should not be.
Case3: The element is namespaced, but the namespace is different from the namespace that the element is supposed to have per the schema definition.
The redesigned of BasicExtendedMetaData supports cases
1 & 2
with a single switch.
Please let me know if you would like sample "Maven Scenario" test cases or anything else submitted.
Thanks, - Ole
The changes have been committed to CVS HEAD.

"applyEdit", "beginCompoundChange", "close", "endCompoundChange", "getLineAtOffset", "getOffsetAtLine", "save", "selectAndReveal"
There are two examples added that show off some potential. First example comments out the current selection. The second example replaces the selection with the current Date/Time.
These objects will enable code snippet insertion, scripted code modifications, and more.

bug.short_desc: Getting IWAB0398E classNofFoundException while creating web serivice

long_desc.thetext:
I am using Eclipse 3.2 and WST 1.5 is installed. I am trying to create Bottom up Web Service. I am getting following error. HelloWorldImpl class is same project directory under folder src. I am not sure what is missing. Any help and suggestion is appreciated
=====IWAB0398E Error in generating WSDL from Java: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.tibco.webservice.test.HelloWorldImpl java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.tibco.webservice.test.HelloWorldImpl at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:407) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:352) at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.DefaultClassLoader.loadClass(DefaultClassLoader.java:83) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at org.apache.tools.ant.AntClassLoader.findBaseClass(AntClassLoader.java:1197) at org.apache.tools.ant.AntClassLoader.loadClass(AntClassLoader.java:990) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at org.apache.axis.utils.ClassUtils$2.run(ClassUtils.java:187) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at org.apache.axis.utils.ClassUtils.loadClass(ClassUtils.java:160) at org.apache.axis.utils.ClassUtils.forName(ClassUtils.java:100) at org.apache.axis.wsdl.fromJava.Emitter.setCls(Emitter.java:2079) at
Moving to web service component.

The "ClassNotFoundException" is occuring via the Apache Axis Java2WSDL emitter. Assuming your HelloWorldImpl.java file is located under src/com/tibco/webservice/test/ and is compiling cleanly, this exception means that the class or something it depends upon could not be loaded from the context of the Web project being targetted by the Web service wizard. Perhaps the most common cause of this is having your Java class in a Java project instead of directly in the target Web project, coupled to the fact that the Web service wizard does not automatically create project Java build path dependencies between Web projects and Java projects.
Is your HelloWorldImpl.java file in a Java project? If so, either... 1. Move your Java file(s) into the target Web project for your service, or 2. Open properties on your target Web project, and use the J2EE Module Dependencies page to select your Java project as a module dependency. This will have the side effect of including your Java project in your Web project's build path, at which point HelloWorldImpl should be loadable by the emitter running in the context of the Web project.
Assigned to you, Kathy. Thanks - CB.
As we have not heard from the originator after 10 months. I'm closing this defect as invalid. Please re-open with the information requested if this is still a problem with recent WTP drivers.

bug.short_desc: ContainerContext Index Manager

long_desc.thetext: Create a Collaboration Context Index Manager. First thought is to use Apache Lucene to index: Chat logs, Mylar Historys, CVS commit history that have been stored in the Jackrabbit repository. Index Manager is responsible for knowing what to index (file types, mime types) and managing location and update frequency of indexes.

The Lucene support inside Jackrabbit supports things like MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint Documents as well as Open Office Documents - we currently have little experience with this support in Jackrabbit.
Lucene provides a way to add indexers for different files types. To add these indexers into the Jackrabbit environment you edit the repository.xml and / or workplace.xml (Is it both or only one?) you add the name of your lucene filter class to SearchIndex param named textFilterClasses
<SearchIndex class="org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.lucene.SearchIndex"> <param name="path" value="${wsp.home}/index"/> <param name="textFilterClasses" value="org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.lucene.TextPlainTextFilter,org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.MsExcelTextFilter,org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.MsPowerPointTextFilter,org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.MsWordTextFilter,org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.PdfTextFilter,org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.HTMLTextFilter,org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.XMLTextFilter,org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.RTFTextFilter,org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.OpenOfficeTextFilter"/>
<!-- These are all default values. You can change them if you want --> <param name="useCompoundFile" value="true"/> <param name="minMergeDocs" value="100"/> <param name="volatileIdleTime" value="3"/> <param name="maxMergeDocs" value="100000"/> <param name="mergeFactor" value="10"/> <param name="bufferSize" value="10"/> <param name="cacheSize" value="1000"/> <param name="forceConsistencyCheck" value="false"/> <param name="autoRepair" value="true"/> <param name="analyzer" value="org.apache.lucene.analysis.standard.StandardAnalyzer"/> <param name="queryClass" value="org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.QueryImpl"/> <param name="idleTime" value="-1"/> <!-- end of default values -->
<param name="respectDocumentOrder" value="false"/> </SearchIndex>

Lucene is integrated with Jackrabbit and Search capability using the Lucene indexing is supported in the JCR interface to Jackrabbit. So, the only work is adding the indexing extensions into Lucene. I added Apache POI project for reading / indexing Microsoft documents and the jar for open office indexing however could not add the PDF indexing since it is GPL license.
Marked as close for 1.0.0M8 build

bug.short_desc: eclipse.versionReplacer throws NPE when MANIFEST.MF files are missing content

long_desc.thetext:
Scenario:
You've done something odd (bug 166132) and you have some extra MANIFEST.MF files kicking around in your project's plugins' src/ folders. Since these aren't PDE-created files, they are nearly blank, eg:
Manifest-Version: 1.0 Class-Path:
and so when you run <eclipse.versionReplacer> on your plugin, it finds these extra MANIFEST.MF files, and throws a NPE instead of quietly skipping the file and proceeding onward.
Can <eclipse.versionReplacer> throw a warning about skipped manifest files? Or if this is a stop condition (can't build) then at least dump a more meaningful error than Ye Olde NPE?
Thanks!

I'm not sure how those files would be found since in a regular build we modify the file in the place where it is copied and we don't do any searching. Having a stacktrace could be good, but a patch would be even better. Thx in advance.

bug.short_desc: Summarize Mylar Action History Information for Workgroup

long_desc.thetext: Since Mylar Action History is stored on the collaboration server (166134) we can aggregate information that is contained within these history files. A collaboration event about a Context Container (to be defined ) would cause this new service called the Mylar History Miner Service to start processing the Action Histories. The History Miner would process all of the histories regarding a particular Context Container. The History Miner would identify: * the most frequently access resources within a Context Container * the most frequently access resources by user role * typical actions by user role ( what each role spent most time doing) * number of "active" Mylar tasks associated with a container * total number of tasks associated with a container * show grouping of Mylar actions by Container | User | Task | Resource
Intergration with Mylar will not be supported. For current release
Intergration with Mylar will not be supported. For current release

bug.short_desc: Create resource relationships based on Mylar Actions

long_desc.thetext: As users interact with resources within ContextContainers they execute actions that relate resources to one another. - We want to identify actions that indicate a strong relationship between 2 or more resources i.e. resources copied from 1 repository to another, - based upon the arrival of a Collaboration Event we want Mylar History Miner Service to automatically create relationships between resources based upon the Mylar actions identified above. - the relationship definitions should include the unique uri of each resource and the relationship type ( defined by another uri). This relationship can then be saved as an RDF triple in Derby Database Table
Intergration with Mylar will not be supported. For current release

bug.short_desc: EMF release notes missing old data

long_desc.thetext:
Compare:
http://www.eclipse.org/emft/news/release-notes.php?project=cdo#r0.7.1 (old) http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emft/news/relnotes.php?project=cdo&version=0.7.1
We're missing 7 bugs for 0.7.1 and 26 bugs for 0.7.0.
http://www.eclipse.org/emft/news/release-notes.php?project=ocl#r1.0.0 http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/mdt/news/relnotes.php?project=uml2-ocl&version=1.0.0
Same story for OCL 1.0.0 - 88 bugs missing.
Is there an easy way to load the old XML into the database so we have complete histories?
The other approach would be to statically generate the XML as HTML, then link to it as we do for EMF, but I'd prefer if we could load all the old data into the database.

The total on the old page for CDO 0.7.1 says 7, but there's really only 2 bugs shown there, and at that, both of those bugs resulted in changes in HEAD, not in R0_7_maintenance:
http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emft/searchcvs.php?q=159290 http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emft/searchcvs.php?q=159270
Looking at the commits that actually were in R0_7_maintenance, none were tagged with a bug:
http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emft/searchcvs.php?q=project%3A+org.eclipse.emft+file%3Aemft%2Fcdo+branch%3A+R0_7+startdate%3A+2006-09-25+18%3A59%3A00+enddate%3A+2006-10-02+19%3A52%3A00
So "0 bugs fixed" is as correct as can be.
As for CDO 0.7.0 and OCL 1.0.0, they're not actually missing, they're just not shown. They're easy to have shown, (checking locally) CDO 0.7.0 fixed 29 bugs, and OCL 1.0.0 fixed 75 bugs.
The only catch is that for OCL 1.0.0, we don't have any intermediate release information left (not in the feeds, no build directories left over, etc), so we can... a) just lump everything together into a big 1.0.0 release with no 1.0.0 RCs or I builds, etc b) heuristically interpolate the dates for each build based on the old release notes page (for vanity named builds only, the dates are obvious for the rest)
I prefer option a, as option b is - rather painful - doesn't gain us much now, given that the pre 1.0.0 builds aren't even available anymore

Furthermore, it looks like the old OCL 1.0.0 release notes have quite a number of duplicate bugs, 125458 for example shows up 5 times, 110649 shows up 4 times, as do 127915 and 129231, to name a few. The new release notes actually catch 6 bugs that had slipped through before (142618, 136068, 129583, 128199, 121452, 117542).
OCL 1.0.0 and CDO 0.7.0 are visible now, I opted for option a. Closing this now.

bug.short_desc: [Viewers] Allow per column sorting in JFace viewers

long_desc.thetext:
The current process for adding column based sorting to Table and Tree viewers is to manually add a selection listener to the individual Columns of the widget. This selection listener either needs to know which comparator to use for which column or the comparator needs to linked to the column using the setData method. It would be nice if there were methods in JFace to make per column sorting easier. I was thinking of something like:
1. Add an optional Sorter or Comparator property to ViewerColumn 2. Have the Table and Tree Viewers add selection listeners to the Columns in the underlying SWT widget 3. When the selection listener is fired for a column it wil look up the ViewerColumn and if it has an attached sorter will set the sorter on the Viewer. Ascending/descending sorting can be handled by wrapping the comparator supplied in the ViewerColumn and multiplying the result by 1 or -1 depending on direction. The selection listener would also be responsible for updating the sort direction indicator on the table.
I think this has been proposed at some other point from somebody different. To some extend I like this new feature.

Hi Tom. I think you might be thinking of an email exchange we had.
I implemented a table viewer that attaches this sort of behaviour directly to a "JFace" representation of the column.
With my implementation, you specify the following for each column:
- An "ascending sort" comparator. This is used (oddly enough) to sort the column. If you click on the header once, it is sorted ascending. If you click a second time, it sorts descending. I was thinking of adding support for sorting on multiple columns.
- An "ObjectAccessor" that is used to get or set the value for an object displayed in the row.
- A cell editor (optional). If no cell editor is provided, the column is not editable.
- A "Cell draw listener" that is called to draw the contents of the cell. I have specialized subclasses of the TableColumnViewer class that do some default drawing, and then use these listeners to further customize.
- Columns can be marked as resizable (or not)
- Columns be given a minimum width
- Columns can be dragged (reordered)
- Columns can be shown/hidden
- You can ask the table to populate a menu with actions to hide/show columns.
I'm happy to contribute it (it's already in Eclipse CVS as part of an RCP sample).
It's hardly API quality (I built what I needed), but there may be some scavengable code/ideas in there...

Hi,
I built an enhanced TableViewer (SortableTableViewer) that can support sorting automatically through type inference. You do not need to specify comparators explicitly every time you instantiate the table; just configure them once in your application, and then whenever a column is clicked, the table intelligently picks the most suitable comparator based on the inferred data type. Optionally, SortableTableViewer lets you specify the comparator directly on a column if you do not want to rely on type-inference. I had this done for a client project that is currently used by more than 25,000 users. I demonstrated it during my presentation "Practical Design Patterns for Rich Client Development" at EclipseWorld 2007, and the audience expressed interest in having such a widget, so I would like to contribute it to Eclipse.
What is the best way to do so?
Andy Maleh

bug.short_desc: deleting about 10 remote connections take up to a minute

long_desc.thetext:
eclipse 3.2.1 with RSE 1.0
Steps To Reproduce: 1. create about 10 remote connections in the rse tree view (SSH, Unix, ...) 2. select all connections and hit delete 3. confirm the upcomming dialog
the action takes up to a minute until all connections are deleted from the rse tree and all jobs have finished
More information: the more connections you use, the better you can see the bug

Looks like this is a revival of bug 153446.
With CVS HEAD as of 1-Dec-2006 out of my local workspace, I'm observing this: * WIth org.eclipse.rse.tests[.framework] installed, do * Window > SHow View > Other > RSE Testing > Test Suites * Select and run the "Persistence Test Suite (Creation)" --> 6 hosts are created in about 2 seconds * Select and run the "Persistence Test Suite (Deletion)" --> Deleting 6 hosts takes 17 seconds, during most of which the system is not available (sandclock displayed).
This seems too slow to me.
-----------Enter bugs above this line----------- installation : eclipse-SDK-3.3M3 RSE install : CVS HEAD as of 1-Dec-2006, running from workspace in dbg mode java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_09-b03 os.name: : Windows XP 5.1, Service Pack 1 ------------------------------------------------ systemtype : Windows-local, Testsuite ------------------------------------------------

I noticed in the debugger, that when I select 48 connections at once and choose contextmenu > delete, at least 400 jobs with corresponding Threads are created. Most of them seem to be of type SystemView$ResourceChangedJob. It appears that they recursively call each other.
After some time, Java runs out of heap memory.
This is not acceptable. Since the entire Eclipse IDE is compromised in this case, I'm increasing severity to CRITICAL. Please check asap. Setting a breakpoint in SystemView$ResourceChangedJob should help finding the reason why so many of them are scheduled.

The problem is that RSE was calling disconnect on each subsystem regardless of whether it was connected or not. Disconnect causes a lot of events to happen. Since you can't delete a connection that is connected, that case should never happen anyway. I've changed the code to not call disconnect if a subsystem is already disconnected and this results in only one ResourceChangeJob.
I deleted 50 connections and did not see any noticeable degradation in performance.

bug.short_desc: VariablesView should use the ISelection object as viewer input.

long_desc.thetext: Currently the Variables view's IDebugContextActivated implementation calls "setViewerInput(((IStructuredSelection)selection).getFirstElement());" to set the viewer input when a selection is changed. This makes the assumption that the selection element itself carries all of the context information that may be needed by the proxy. This is actually not a big deal, since the model proxy factory can also be registered as IDebugContextActivated listener, but it seems to me that the correct thing to do would be to set the whole ISelection object as the viewer input.

There would be a problem getting the content adapter if we use ISelection as the input... since the selection is an IStructuredSelection (StructuredSelection), there could only be 2 adapters registered for the input - we need to use the model objects to support different content adapters.
Right, that's good enough explanation for me. Feel free to reject the bug.
Marking as won't fix.

bug.short_desc: selecting multiple connections and opening the popup menu is very slow

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: eclipse 3.2.1 with rse 1.0
Steps To Reproduce: 1. create about 50 connections (use the test framework to do this atomatically) 2. select the first connection 3. scroll down to the end of the list 4. hold down the "shift" button and click on the last connection
--> first of all the last connection gets selected, after a couple of seconds (depending on the connection count) all connections get selected --> don't know if this is normal eclipse behaviour, but it is not verry nice
5. click the right mouse button on the selection to open the popup menu
--> the menu opens after a couple of seconds, this takes definitely to long!
More information: the more connections you use, the better you can see the "bug".

Looks like this is a revival of bug 153446.
With CVS HEAD as of 1-Dec-2006 out of my local workspace, I'm observing this: * With org.eclipse.rse.tests[.framework] installed, do * Window > SHow View > Other > RSE Testing > Test Suites * Select and run the "Persistence Test Suite (Creation)" --> 6 hosts are created * Repeate the same step 7 more times --> get a total of 48 connections * Select the first one, scroll down, SHIFT+select the last one --> performing the select on all (collapsed) connections takes about 6 seconds * Right-click in the selection --> showing the context menu takes about 5 seconds * Use alt+tab to switch to a different window, then back to RSE --> Painting the Eclipse screen takes about 2 seconds
All of this seems too slow to me.
-----------Enter bugs above this line----------- installation : eclipse-SDK-3.3M3 RSE install : CVS HEAD as of 1-Dec-2006, running from workspace in dbg mode java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_09-b03 os.name: : Windows XP 5.1, Service Pack 1 ------------------------------------------------ systemtype : Windows-local, Testsuite ------------------------------------------------

The performance problem is that SystemView.getTreeItemPosition() is getting parentItem children for every item it compares, even though the same parentItem children need to be retrieved for each call. A more optimal way to do this is to retrieve all the parentItem children in advance and then pass those children into the method each time. This is now fixed.
This seems to be much faster. I don't see any noticeable degradation in performance with 50 connections!

bug.short_desc: Needs to refresh twice to see the stored procedure list

The design do not has TOC expression in table group. So we can not show "USA" in toc. But it was ok in old BIRT, since we can set group data as default TOC expression. Re-asign to model for deep research. BTW, Xingjie knew this bug.
The group expression should be used as the default expression of the TOC node. Check if there any logical changed for the new TOC cause this bug.
*** Bug 166914 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
The behavior of this bug is right.Now the rule is changed. When user create table group, UI can't set TOC expression automatically. Close it.

bug.short_desc: No data retrived when a element or root has a text and a sub element node [0701]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: No data retrived when a element or root has a text and a sub element node, and if use the sub element as XPath mapping the data is invalid such as "test + node information " when preview the results
Build number: 2.2.0.v20061127-0710
Steps to reproduce: (1)Scenorio1: 1, New a xml file such as <root> text <node> node information </node> </root> 2, New a datasource with the xml file or attached xml file 3, New a XML data set, use /root as the table mapping. 4, Use Name:root XPath:null as column mapping 5, Preview the results in table preview
(2)Scenario2: 1, Do first three steps 2, Use Name:node XPath:/node as column mapping 3, Preview the results in table preview
(3)Scenario3: 1, Use attached Multi_Element.xml 2, Use /root as table mapping 3, Use Name:root XPath: /paper/chapter[1]/section[2]/title as column mapping 4, Preview the results in table preview
Expected result: (1)Scenario1: "text" is shown in table preview (2)Scenario2: "node information" is shown in table preview (3)Scenario3: "chapter[1]/section[2]/title[1];" is shown in table preview Actual result: (1)Scenario1: Nothing preview (2)Scenario2: "textnode information" preview (3)Scenario3: "chapter[1]/section[2];chapter[1]/section[2]/title[1];" preview
Created an attachment (id=54691) Multi_Element for scenario3
Fixed in source
closed regards

bug.short_desc: ODA IResultSet.close never been called in DtE

long_desc.thetext: In DtE, we will close IConnection and IQuery from ODA, however the IResultSet.close() has never be called so that it is possible that even the ODA connection is closed the IResultSet is still open(If it is not closed when the IQuery or IConnection is closed). This is incorrect and needs a fix.
Set odaResultSet when initializing CachedResultSet so that the former can be closed together with the latter

bug.short_desc: Strange behaviour for implicit iterators

long_desc.thetext:
Assume a meta model that has a metaclass A with a to-one reference to a metaclass B called b.
If I call a.b in an expression, the resulting collection contains nulls for each of the As where the b reference is null.
This looks like unintended behaviour....
Sven?

I'm not sure what you mean.
Is it that you have a list of a and want to call the collect short cut? I.e.:
{a1,a2,a3}.b
where the result is:
{b1, b2, null} when a3.b == null?
I would consider this being intentional.
yes, the scenario you describe is what I meant.
Me too. Maybe we should provide an extension in the stdLib to filter null-elements from collections?

I have added such a utility (collections::filterNulls in stdlib).
Once we can actually load these .ext files from the library this will be really useful :-)

bug.short_desc: variables details wrong for base objects with hidden members

long_desc.thetext:
1.Create new CDT project with the attached file. 2.Start debugging. 3.Step to "return 0" line. 4.Expand all of 's' in the variables view. 5.Observer that the values of base class' members are correct. 6. Click on base class's member 'i'. 7. Observe that the value in details view is not correct -- it's '1' but it should be 123.
The problem is that expression Eclipse uses to populate the details is: (s).i, but it should actually be ((B&)s).i.
Created an attachment (id=54692) test testcase source

bug.short_desc: [Wizards] File->New->Project (Select a wizard) does not respond to keyboard on Windows 64 bit

long_desc.thetext:
File->New->Project (Select a wizard) doesnt allow use of the mouse to select any of the available options or to drop down to view any of the sub-menus.
The keyboard can still be used to select any of the options. However even this is difficult as the options become highlighted as the keyboard is used to pass over them. The only way to know which is being selected is by the description at the top of the dialog.
If a wizard is then selected the next wizard dialog doesnt render to screen properly.
Note: Windows XP 64-bit using jdk1.5.08 32 bit Eclipse 3.1 Doesnt seem to have this issue.
I have exact same situation. Common things are: Eclipse 3.2 and Windows XP 64-bit
I can also confirm this is a issue with 3.2 (where the keyboard can sort of select items, but I can't seem to add a new project) and with 3.3 (where the dialog box does't even come up.
the same for Windows Server 2003 64bit. Using JDK1.6.0 32bit 3.2 - doesn't allow to click the project type 3.3M5eh - the tree with project types is not displayed at all
Same experience here. Windows 2003 64-bit SP2. Combinations tried 3.2.1, 3.2.2, 3.3M6 with Java 1.5 and 1.6.
Created an attachment (id=63115) Running 3.3M6 on Windows 2003 x64 SP2, JDK 1.6 update 1.

Have recent;y installed 64bit windows xp and re-installed eclipse 3.3 and am unable to choose any wizards, get the same view as that supplied by Daniel Cardenas. Have most recent java release as well.
I'm also experiencing this with Windows XP x64 SP1. Any possiblity of a relationship to https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=204953 ?

attachment.desc: Running 3.3M6 on Windows 2003 x64 SP2, JDK 1.6 update 1.

More information:

The problem here is that we need the ID of the task, not the key which is what we get from ILinkedTaskInfo. We can search by key to find the corresponding task, but for now I have simply popped up message dialog prompting the user to use the Open Task dialog, and we fall back to opening with the web browser.
If you could give this a try with the JIRA task that it failed with that would be helpful.
I looked again and I think that ILinkedTaskInfo.getTaskId() will either need to return the unique task ID (not JIRA key), or the name of that method needs to change. So over to you for now.

(In reply to comment #2) > I looked again and I think that ILinkedTaskInfo.getTaskId() will either need to > return the unique task ID (not JIRA key), or the name of that method needs to > change. So over to you for now.
Task key for jira won't be available from the linked task info. Is is simply not available from the information we can get.
BTW, why can't you just show that open task/remote task dialog (with task id filled in) if taskui can't open the editor?

Not at this stage, but yes, we should do that.
I know that it's not available in the comment, but either it has to be looked up when the ILinkedTaskInfo is created (either in the Task List or on server), or we have to change the name of the method to getIdLabel() to be consistent with AbstractRepositoryTask. Thoughts?

(In reply to comment #4) > I know that it's not available in the comment, but either it has to be looked > up when the ILinkedTaskInfo is created (either in the Task List or on server), > or we have to change the name of the method to getIdLabel() to be consistent > with AbstractRepositoryTask. Thoughts?
You know that I never liked these internal ids. Anyways, I don't think implementor of ILinkedTaskInfo should know or do anything about internal task ids. Also, changing method name is probably distractive at this stage (i.e. it will break Subclipse integration).
As a workaround you can use id returned by linked task info to query internal id, but that logic should be in open corresponding task action or some utility class that action is using.
OK, leaving as is for 1.0, let's revisit after.

The Open Repository Task dialog should show a message that an invalid task id was entered instead of logging an error to the Eclipse log.
I would expect it to work without any error messages. :-)
Even better :).

Because we still have code that relies on parsing for the last occurrence of '-'. So for 2.0M1 I can only think of two options: 1) Escape occurrences of '-' in the taskId. However, not that JIRA should *not* be using the key as the taskId, because that will cause issues to lose identity when they move between components. The actual ID shoudl be used, for the same reason that JIRA uses it internally--it uniquely identifies the issue no matter what its attributes are. 2) Instead of parsing for the last occurrence of '-' in RepositoryTaskHandleUtil, it may be possible to first find the repository URL, then use the rest of the string (less '-') as the handle.
For now I think the best thing to do is just fix this instance of the problem by Steffen doing what he proposed in comment#34, no?

I think we need to differentiate the different possible cases here:
Current implementation:
1) task is in task list: look up by handle TasksUiUtil.openRepositoryTask() -> TaskList.getTask()
- Fails for JIRA keys since handle is composed of id
2) task is not in task list TasksUiUtil.openRepositoryTask() -> AbstractRepositoryConnecotr.openRepositoryTask() -> OpenRepositoryTaskJob.run()
2a) task data available Open editor
- Throws exception while constructing handle but would work for JIRA since task can be retrieved by key as well as id.
2b) task data not available Open url: AbstractRepositoryConnecotr.getTaskWebUrl()
- Works for keys but not for ids?

Because TaskList has list of tasks, all we need is to search trough those tasks. Furthermore we still have not solved the fundamental issues that are caused by the key/id ambiguity. (In reply to comment #64) > We won't get this fixed in 2.0M1 but I am going to take a shot at creating a > patch this weekend that will use a mapping function as mentioned in comment 49.
Steffen, please don't do this! Each task does have web url, and each connector know how to construct that url from the user-readable key (or id). That url (and connector/repository type) is sufficient for retrieving task from the task list or even remote task. The problem we are suffering now is that common code is still constructing handles even for the cases when task instance is around and handle can be retrieved from the task.
PS: the weirdest part is that I've been waiting for about two months to see this fixed, but all it takes is to actually remove throwing this exception. So, even handle is invalid, it is usually used to get task from the task list, so there won't be task for such broken handle, but all common code fall into full task list scan after that anyways.

(In reply to comment #68) > Each task does have web url, and each connector > know how to construct that url from the user-readable key (or id).
Basically, we are now using the URL as a unique identifier for tasks (IMHO we should get rid of handles then).
AbstractRepositoryConnector.getTaskWebUrl() and getTaskIdFromTaskUrl() are exactly the mapping functions is was talking about. These needs to be fixed for JIRA though. The former should work for handles as well as ids whereas the later should always return the id and never the key.
> PS: the weirdest part is that I've been waiting for about two months to see this > fixed, but all it takes is to actually remove throwing this exception. So, even > handle is invalid, it is usually used to get task from the task list, so there > won't be task for such broken handle, but all common code fall into full task > list scan after that anyways.
Allowing the construction of invalid handles does not seem like a good idea to me.

Let's discuss this during the meeting next Tuesday. It's an important and tricky issue. Just fyi, while connectors can dynamically create URLs to uniquely identify tasks, we can't use that format for persisting the identity (e.g. in contexts) because URL handles contain segments that are implementation details and can change (e.g. show_bug.cgi).

(In reply to comment #69) > Basically, we are now using the URL as a unique identifier for tasks (IMHO we > should get rid of handles then).
It doesn't have to be unique.
> AbstractRepositoryConnector.getTaskWebUrl() and getTaskIdFromTaskUrl() are > exactly the mapping functions is was talking about. These needs to be fixed for > JIRA though. The former should work for handles as well as ids whereas the > later should always return the id and never the key.
I am not quite sure about that. You will need server roundtrip or look trough TaskList to get id from JIRA task key. Since task data retrieveal will require key anyways, it seem not necessary.
> > PS: the weirdest part is that I've been waiting for about two months to see this > > fixed, but all it takes is to actually remove throwing this exception. So, even > > handle is invalid, it is usually used to get task from the task list, so there > > won't be task for such broken handle, but all common code fall into full task > > list scan after that anyways. > > Allowing the construction of invalid handles does not seem like a good idea to > me.
Well, I bet it would fix most of the current issues. I think it would be a better idea then wait another two months...

> > AbstractRepositoryConnector.getTaskWebUrl() and getTaskIdFromTaskUrl() are > > exactly the mapping functions is was talking about. These needs to be fixed > for > > JIRA though. The former should work for handles as well as ids whereas the > > later should always return the id and never the key. > I am not quite sure about that. You will need server roundtrip or look trough > TaskList to get id from JIRA task key. Since task data retrieveal will require > key anyways, it seem not necessary.
Good point. I was more arguing from an API point of view. I suggest that we make it clear by adding comments and renaming variables for JIRA when a key is expected (e.g. use these as variable names: keyOrId, key, id).
> > > PS: the weirdest part is that I've been waiting for about two months to see > this > > > fixed, but all it takes is to actually remove throwing this exception. So, > even > > > handle is invalid, it is usually used to get task from the task list, so > there > > > won't be task for such broken handle, but all common code fall into full > task > > > list scan after that anyways. > > > > Allowing the construction of invalid handles does not seem like a good idea to > > me. > Well, I bet it would fix most of the current issues. I think it would be a > better idea then wait another two months...
I agree. I will attach a patch shortly that does not use the broken handle for the task editor input but constructs a "clean" handle.

Created an attachment (id=59228) Fixes opening of remote tasks for JIRA
This patch fixes the handle construction for remote tasks. It also escapes handles that contain dashes. Please note, that this does not mean that JIRA ever uses dashes to construct handles but other connectors might need to do that. For JIRA the task list lookup by handle will fail and it will fall back to downloading the task data.
The downside to handle escaping is that we may need to convert existing handles whenever deriving ids from handles is not required anymore and therefore the escaping can be dropped as well.
I will now shut up and stop adding to the confusion.

Created an attachment (id=59896) disable "corectness" in a favor to something that can be actually used
It seems like it is taking way to long to fix this issue. So, I am strongly suggesting to remove correctness check (as in the attached patch), so JIRA linking features will be actually usable. Mik, you can refactor it later to make it comletetly correct, but now we just have to make it work (at any price).
Also note, that commenting this makes open repository task and open correspong actions work fine for JIRA tasks. Though there is a weird bug, when opening corresponding JIRA task that is not in the Task List, task editor show internal JIRA id and not the key, which is completely confusing.
Most recent patch applied, next to most recent OpenRepositoryTaskJob part of patch applied.
Fyi, I did not have time to verify the behavior for JIRA. Can do so on Friday.

(In reply to comment #75) > Most recent patch applied, next to most recent OpenRepositoryTaskJob part of > patch applied.
Thanks Mik. Can you please put in a dev build with those changes and Rob's fix for JIRA detector for the text editors?

I get an exception when opening a remote JIRA task. I can take a look later today.
org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:95) at org.eclipse.ui.part.MultiPageEditorPart.setActivePage(MultiPageEditorPart.java:690) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.FormEditor.setActivePage(FormEditor.java:624) at org.eclipse.ui.part.MultiPageEditorPart.createPartControl(MultiPageEditorPart.java:282) [...]

Added check to JiraTaskDataHandler if task was downloaded successfully and fixed the construction of handle that I missed in the original patch. I was able to open a remote JIRA task in an editor with these fixes.
I think the assertion is triggered when the web browser widget is disabled and no rich editor is available.
*** Bug 174521 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
As far as I can tell we're done here. Remaining work related to this should go on bug 149624.

bug.short_desc: [Change Sets] Improve display of multi-line CVS comments for Changesets

long_desc.thetext:
In the Team Sync perspective / Changeset model, the CVS comments are displayed as one, long line.
I would prefer them to see as multi-line comments.
Alternatively, a nicely formatted tool-tip would be great. This could also applied to the entries in the History view.
The number of lines to display should be configurable and if exceeded, trailing ellipsis ("...") could be displayed.
Possibly, there are other places where the a "CVS comment tooltip" is applicable.
In the "Outgoing Mode", the change set tooltip could display the current check-in comment of the change set.

Unfortunately, tree tooltips are used to show the item label if it is wider than the view so we can't really use them for something else. You could have a popup like the onces in the Java editor for content assist. Unfortunately, we don't have the manpower to address this issue but we are happy to accept contributions.

bug.short_desc: no variable highlighting and no Marking of Occurrences

long_desc.thetext:
When I open a PHP file and click on a variable (ex: $thisYear), the variable doesn't get highlighted and the occurrences are not 'marked' as well !
This feature is working well when editing Java code, but it doesn't work with PHP code.
Note that I've installed Eclipse IDE with PHP Plugin from:
http://download.eclipse.org/tools/php/downloads/index.php?release=S20061026-M3
changed severity to enhancement
*** Bug 177540 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 178034 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 156799 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I recommend that the severity and priority of this bug be increased significantly.
I just installed the PDT plugin, and am impressed by many of the enhancements missing in PHPeclipse.
However, the absence of this feature alone (marking of occurrences) may be reason for me to revert back to PHPeclipse. I didn't realize how much time this feature saves me until I didn't have it anymore. Now, I can only think of the time I'd waste with it not working in PDT.
*** Bug 189093 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Y'know, as a workaround, CTRL-K will bounce the cursor around from selection to selection. It's sorta like CTRL-F-again, but you don't need to use CTRL-F to make it work -- just select some text and hit CTRL-K to cycle thru occurrences.
That said, +1 for this bug, too.

I find this feature very crucial for me to use pdt and drop phpeclipse. Please add it to 1.0
Thanks
Disabling this feature was a very bad idea. To see that for yourselves, try turning "Mark occurences" in Java Perspective. It's a pity I can't give all my votes to that single bug.

I'm in charge of maintaining and upgrading the toolset of my development team, and I'm withholding my stamp of approval on PDT until this feature is implemented. It is HIGHLY crucial to our workflow. I would love to get rid of phpeclipse in favor of PDT, but I won't without this, sorry.
In short, I would like to see this feature given higher priority.

I also give my vote to higher priority for this task. Currently we are working with PHPeclipse and the missing "Mark occurrences" function is really a showstopper for our team (this applies also for the new PDT based "Zend Studio for eclipse")
BTW see also plans for PDT 1.5 (http://wiki.eclipse.org/PDT_1.5_Plan) and Bug https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=152088
Like for others, it's one of the features, that'll make me go back to PHPeclipse.
I really hope this gets fixed soon... Just installed PDT on my laptop to try it out. I'm definitely sticking with PHPEclipse until this feature is added.

bug.short_desc: Different cvs results from "Team Synchronize" and "java" perspectives

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060629-1905
I get a different set of cvs changes depending on whether I am in 1) Team Synchronize perspective and presses cvs syncronize for a project 2) java perspective and presses team menu and "synchronize with represitory"
The second seems to recursive the packages better. This is real bad as nobody I talked to knew there was a difference as the perspective is allways changed to team synchronize.

I'm not really sure what you mean here. Could you give a bit more detail describing the actions you took in both perspectives and what the results were. Perhaps you could include screenshots. Feel free to reopen with the requested information.

First, it is not always there is a difference in the set of changes found by eclipse, but if there is, then the set from 1) is a subset from 2). So basicly some files are missing from the set from 1). Therefor I havent found a way to reproduce it. I found a bug report, where it was explicit said in the comments that this was the expected behaviour (e.i. that they differ), but I can find it now.
It happens fairly often - it happens for me approx. once a day in a new project with approx 40 commits a day - where I make the 15 of them.
When I want to commit some files I have 2 choice. 1) Change to team synchronize perspective and press the synchronize button (if I have made any synchronizing on a specific package, the I need to ask specific for synchronizing the whole project again).
2) I can remain in the java persective, and in the explore view, with the right mouse button menu choose "team"->synchronize with repository".

Unfortunately, there's still not enough information in this bug report to help us reproduce it and, if we can't reproduce it, we can't fix it. We have fixed some bugs that involved missing content in 3.2.1 and in the 3.2.2 development stream so it is also possible that the problem is fixed. What I would ask you to do is try 3.2.1 (or, if your adventurous, the latest M build) and see if the problem still occurs. If the problem does still occur, I'd ask you to take a screen shot of both cases (i.e. the one that failed and the one that worked) and reopen this bug. This usually gives us enough information to reproduce the problem.
Alternatively, you can switch to using the non modal-based Sync. Here's a link that describes the two types of Synchronizations and how to switch between them.
http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/CVS_FAQ#Synchronizing_has_some_regressions_in_Eclipse_3.2._Why.3F
Closing due to lack of response. If you are still experiencing this problem, please reopen with the requested information.

bug.short_desc: OutOfMemoryError when working with corona plugins.

long_desc.thetext:
When working with eclipse which have corona plugins installed, after several hours (without restarting the Workbench) OutOfMemoryError appears. We need to use a profiler (TPTP?) to check where the memory leaks can be.
The problem is that the memory leaks might be in 3rd party libraries (like the bug with broken images).
Stack trace: ------------------------------------------------------ hEvent(EventAdminImpl.java:58) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager.dispatchEvent(EventM anager.java:189) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager$EventThread.run(Even tManager.java:291) (trace)org.eclipse.ecf.provider.Trace.err[11/28/06;18:12:54:113]StringID[coronaC lient[cwpl-pjaworow]: cwpl-0134(172.18.131.133)-1164733974113]:org.eclipse.coron a.client.ecf.CoronaClientSOContainer:Exception in connect java.net.UnknownHostException: corona at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.ecf.provider.comm.tcp.SocketFactory.createSocket(SocketFa ctory.java:30) at org.eclipse.ecf.provider.comm.tcp.Client.connect(Client.java:218) at org.eclipse.ecf.provider.generic.ClientSOContainer.connect(ClientSOCo ntainer.java:130) at org.eclipse.corona.client.ecf.Topic.createContainer(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.corona.collaboration.ecf.AbstractTopic.initTopic(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.corona.client.ecf.Topic.<init>(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.corona.client.ecf.EventRouter.createLocalTopic(Unknown So urce) at org.eclipse.corona.client.ecf.EventRouter.createTopic(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.corona.client.ecf.EventRouter.handleEvent(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.corona.collaboration.Activator.handleEvent(Unknown Source ) at org.eclipse.equinox.event.EventAdminImpl$EventAdminDispatcher.dispatc hEvent(EventAdminImpl.java:58) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager.dispatchEvent(EventM anager.java:189) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager$EventThread.run(Even tManager.java:291) Fatal error happened during workbench emergency close. java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space Error while logging event loop exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:46) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.transfer(ImplicitJobs.jav a:235) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.transferRule(JobManager.jav a:1154) at null (authors comment: about 30 times at null appears here) at null Logging exception: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space Error while logging event loop exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:46) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.transfer(ImplicitJobs.jav a:235) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.transferRule(JobManager.jav a:1154) at null (authors comment: about 30 times at null appears here) at null Logging exception: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space

After some investigation, no proofs were found that the bug was caused by Corona plugins. It seams that bug occur only when some "stub" projects builds are performed with ant task downloading required jar files. When I turned off that build mechanism the OutOfMemoryError did not occur anymore.
I'll keep this bug open, to check whether this is the real reason.
Decided to postpone the bug. If error occurs again, will have to reopen it.
