bug.short_desc: Category (X) axis for DateTime Series on Bar Chart cannot be formatted

long_desc.thetext:
From the newsgroup thread, formatted slightly, with responses from David Michonneau:
I have a bar chart in a report (Report A) wherein the X-axis 'category series' is made up of time slices, e.g. months of the year (Jan 1 2006 00:00 GMT, Feb 1 2006 00:00 GMT etc.), and the Y-axis is a number of events per time slice. My desired behaviour is that when clicking on a bar in the chart, I can re-direct to another report (Report B), which reports in more detail for that particular time slice.
All works well, except that the value of the time slice in the generated redirect URL parameter list is not the full date/time format string I need to map back to a long, allowing me to query the database in the subsequent report. What I get on clicking on the column is:
?startTime=01/01/2006 00:00
as the report parameter, which isn't a parsable/unambiguous date. What I would need is something like the full date/time string representation, which *is* configurable for the category labels in Report A, i.e.
?startTime=Sunday 27 November 2005 00:00:00 GMT
Now, referring to the source code for 2.1.0, as far as I can ascertain drill-thru functionality is defined in a trigger. The trigger in this case is caused by an ActionType.URL_REDIRECT_LITERAL action, and the value for this parameter is populated from the DataPointHints.getBaseDisplayValue(). What I'm seeing in debug is that the FormatSpecifier for this is null, so I'm getting a simple format of the underlying CDateTime datapoint.
Tracing the construction of the DataTypeComponentImpl it looks like its created from the report design file, as specified for the series by the <Series><DataPoint><Components> element. Its type there is specified as "Orthogonal_Value", whereas looking in the 'PlotWith2DAxes' class it would appear that for the FormatSpecifier to get set, my time series category would need to be of type "Base_Value". However, I can't seem to set this from the report designer plugin, and even if I did set it, I'm not sure that this would do what I need....
> David Michonneau wrote: > You need to set the FormatSpecifier for the category series, since you > saw it null while debugging, I assume it is not set. I think you should > be able to set it from the chart builder, next to the category series > input box, there is a #.# button, did you try that?
I tried setting it in the 'Edit Chart/Select Data tab/Category (X) Series/0.0#' dialog (Date/Time, Standard, Full/Date) and in the 'Edit Chart/Format Chart tab/Series tree node' there seems to be a way to set the type of each series, but the 'Category (X) Series': is defaulted to a 'Simple Series' type and cannot be changed, at least in 2.1.0. The Chart Area/Axis node I can select the type and this is set to DateTime...
> David > I see. There is indeed a bug in PlotWithAxes.getSeriesRenderingHints (and > PlotWithoutAxes.getSeriesRenderingHints too), there shouldn't be any if > blocks there, removing them fixes the problem. Can you file a bugzilla entry > for this?
> Here is the fixed code fyi (same as before without if blocks):
for ( int i = 0; i < el.size( ); i++ ) { dpc = (DataPointComponent) el.get( i ); dpct = dpc.getType( ); fsBase = dpc.getFormatSpecifier( ); if ( fsBase == null ) // BACKUP { fsBase = sdBase.getFormatSpecifier( ); } fsOrthogonal = dpc.getFormatSpecifier( ); if ( fsOrthogonal == null && seOrthogonal.eContainer( ) instanceof SeriesDefinition ) { fsOrthogonal = ( (SeriesDefinition) seOrthogonal.eContainer( ) ).getFormatSpecifier( ); } fsSeries = dpc.getFormatSpecifier( ); fsPercentile = dpc.getFormatSpecifier( ); }
fixed on 11/30/2006
Created an attachment (id=55131) report design demonstrating the problem. Note the ?time parameter in the target link.
An exception is thrown with chinese locale

Fixed. You should now use the drill-through parameters (in edit base url dialog), you can access the databindings there now. Those will always work independently of the locale.
As for the previous one, it only works in english, but that is another bug on the viewer side: report parameters should be accepted in english or current locale when set in the url. You can file another bug for this, it can be reproduced by calling a simple url to a report with a datetime parameter formatted in the locale of the target report.
The chart will format those parameters in url according to current locale. This could be expected in some cases where the target page (which is not necessary a report) will re-use those formatted values.

attachment.desc: report design demonstrating the problem. Note the ?time parameter in the target link.

bug.short_desc: "abstract" workflows

long_desc.thetext:
I would like to see an additional property on workflow definitons that states that workflows are "abstract". abstract workflows are not meant to be called directly, rather they are expected to be called from another workflow.
If we had this "abstract" property, we could output a nice error message that tells the developers that the file should not be called directly - instead of getting all kinds of "property suchandsuch not defined" messages.
added.

bug.short_desc: Container Event Filtering

long_desc.thetext: Provide the ability to filter collaboration events. Plugins that extend the collaboration event handler extension point should be able to define filter criteria to only receive collaboration events that they are interested in.

A new ContextContainer event model was implemented. The ContextContainerEventManager will interact with the event handlers that extend the AbstractContainerEventHandler class.
The event filtering provided is based upon the OSGi Filter class. Each event handler can supply an optional filter to determine if the event is handled or not.

bug.short_desc: CIM xml - communication should be traced into a single separate file

long_desc.thetext: Currently the CIM xml trace (if enabled) is traced - depending on if the item to trace is a request or a response - to the console-window or to a trace-file. The trace for both requests and responses should be traced within the same file.

Unfortunately the SBLIMCimClient does not provide a way to have incoming requests (from Aperi) and corresponding responsens to be traced into a single file. This would be a very important feature when dealing with new device-type where you need to correlate requests with their responses.
As a workaround I recommend downloading the sourcecode for the SBLIMCimClient. One file needs to be extracted and added into the org.sblim.cim.client package included in Aperi. Fetch org.sblim.wbem.xml.XMLDefaultHandlerImpl.java and modify line 187 as follows:
private static Writer cOut = new PrintWriter(GlobalProperties.getDebugOutputStream()/*System.out*/);
With this change requests and responses will be traced to cimxmltrace.txt on the deviceserver if debug.xml.input and debug.xml.output are set to true in the database table T_RES_CONFIG_DATA.

Since this problem can not be fixed within Aperi, please revise the workaround described above. Please communicate this workaround within the team, since it would be very helpfull during plugfests or development for new devices.
Reopened because I think it would be helpfull to have this on the radar.
Lower the severity to be enchancement

bug.short_desc: Missing Generator Adapter Extension Schema file

long_desc.thetext:
When I try to use the New Extension wizard to add an extension to extension point org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.generatorAdapters, I get the following error. Found the reference to the schema file in the plugin.xml file in org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore_2.2.2.v200611230200.jar, but no schema subdirectory or generatorAdapters.exsd file is in the jar. Or in the EMF source code.
Ed Merk's research into the problem found this:
It looks like the build.properties is not specifying to package it up:
bin.includes = about.html,\ plugin.properties,\ plugin.xml,\ templates/,\ codegen.ecore.jar,\ model/,\ META-INF/
The fix is committed to CVS.
